revised_title: Free Vibrations of Uniform Suspended Cables: A Linear Theory
tldr: The authors develop a linear theory for the free vibrations of uniform suspended cables with a sag-to-span ratio of about 1:8 or less. Both in-plane and out-of-plane motion is considered, and the analysis focuses on the symmetric in-plane modes, which are heavily dependent on a parameter accounting for cable geometry and elasticity. The theory is validated through simple experiments.
